speaker: Lord
text_entry: ACT IV

speaker: Lord
text_entry: SCENE I. A cavern. In the middle, a boiling cauldron.

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Thunder. Enter the three Witches

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Thrice the brinded cat hath mew'd.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Thrice and once the hedge-pig whined.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Harpier cries 'Tis time, 'tis time.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Round about the cauldron go;

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: In the poison'd entrails throw.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Toad, that under cold stone

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Days and nights has thirty-one

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Swelter'd venom sleeping got,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Boil thou first i' the charmed pot.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Double, double toil and trouble;

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Fire burn, and cauldron bubble.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Fillet of a fenny snake,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: In the cauldron boil and bake;

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Eye of newt and toe of frog,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Wool of bat and tongue of dog,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Adder's fork and blind-worm's sting,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Lizard's leg and owlet's wing,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: For a charm of powerful trouble,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Like a hell-broth boil and bubble.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Double, double toil and trouble;

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Fire burn and cauldron bubble.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Scale of dragon, tooth of wolf,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Witches' mummy, maw and gulf

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Of the ravin'd salt-sea shark,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Root of hemlock digg'd i' the dark,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Liver of blaspheming Jew,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Gall of goat, and slips of yew

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Silver'd in the moon's eclipse,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Nose of Turk and Tartar's lips,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Finger of birth-strangled babe

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Ditch-deliver'd by a drab,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Make the gruel thick and slab:

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Add thereto a tiger's chaudron,

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: For the ingredients of our cauldron.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Double, double toil and trouble;

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Fire burn and cauldron bubble.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Cool it with a baboon's blood,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Then the charm is firm and good.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Enter HECATE to the other three Witches

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: O well done! I commend your pains;

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And every one shall share i' the gains;

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: And now about the cauldron sing,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Live elves and fairies in a ring,

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Enchanting all that you put in.

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: Music and a song: 'Black spirits,'  and c

speaker: HECATE
text_entry: HECATE retires

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: By the pricking of my thumbs,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Something wicked this way comes.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Open, locks,

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Whoever knocks!

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Enter MACBETH

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: How now, you secret, black, and midnight hags!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What is't you do?

speaker: ALL
text_entry: A deed without a name.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I conjure you, by that which you profess,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Howe'er you come to know it, answer me:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Though you untie the winds and let them fight

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Against the churches; though the yesty waves

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Confound and swallow navigation up;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Though bladed corn be lodged and trees blown down;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Though castles topple on their warders' heads;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Though palaces and pyramids do slope

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Their heads to their foundations; though the treasure

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of nature's germens tumble all together,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Even till destruction sicken; answer me

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To what I ask you.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Speak.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Demand.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: We'll answer.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Say, if thou'dst rather hear it from our mouths,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Or from our masters?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Call 'em; let me see 'em.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Pour in sow's blood, that hath eaten

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Her nine farrow; grease that's sweaten

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: From the murderer's gibbet throw

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Into the flame.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Come, high or low;

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Thyself and office deftly show!

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Thunder. First Apparition: an armed Head

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Tell me, thou unknown power,--

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: He knows thy thought:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Hear his speech, but say thou nought.

speaker: First Apparition
text_entry: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth! beware Macduff;

speaker: First Apparition
text_entry: Beware the thane of Fife. Dismiss me. Enough.

speaker: First Apparition
text_entry: Descends

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whate'er thou art, for thy good caution, thanks;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou hast harp'd my fear aright: but one

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: word more,--

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: He will not be commanded: here's another,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: More potent than the first.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Thunder. Second Apparition: A bloody Child

speaker: Second Apparition
text_entry: Macbeth! Macbeth! Macbeth!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Had I three ears, I'ld hear thee.

speaker: Second Apparition
text_entry: Be bloody, bold, and resolute; laugh to scorn

speaker: Second Apparition
text_entry: The power of man, for none of woman born

speaker: Second Apparition
text_entry: Shall harm Macbeth.

speaker: Second Apparition
text_entry: Descends

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Then live, Macduff: what need I fear of thee?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But yet I'll make assurance double sure,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And take a bond of fate: thou shalt not live;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That I may tell pale-hearted fear it lies,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And sleep in spite of thunder.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thunder. Third Apparition: a Child crowned, with a tree in his hand

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What is this

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That rises like the issue of a king,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And wears upon his baby-brow the round

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And top of sovereignty?

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Listen, but speak not to't.

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Be lion-mettled, proud; and take no care

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Who chafes, who frets, or where conspirers are:

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Macbeth shall never vanquish'd be until

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Great Birnam wood to high Dunsinane hill

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Shall come against him.

speaker: Third Apparition
text_entry: Descends

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That will never be

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Who can impress the forest, bid the tree

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Unfix his earth-bound root? Sweet bodements! good!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Rebellion's head, rise never till the wood

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of Birnam rise, and our high-placed Macbeth

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shall live the lease of nature, pay his breath

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To time and mortal custom. Yet my heart

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Throbs to know one thing: tell me, if your art

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Can tell so much: shall Banquo's issue ever

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Reign in this kingdom?

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Seek to know no more.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: I will be satisfied: deny me this,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And an eternal curse fall on you! Let me know.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why sinks that cauldron? and what noise is this?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Hautboys

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Show!

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Show!

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Show!

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Show his eyes, and grieve his heart;

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Come like shadows, so depart!

speaker: ALL
text_entry: A show of Eight Kings, the last with a glass in his hand; GHOST OF BANQUO following

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou art too like the spirit of Banquo: down!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thy crown does sear mine eye-balls. And thy hair,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thou other gold-bound brow, is like the first.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A third is like the former. Filthy hags!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why do you show me this? A fourth! Start, eyes!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What, will the line stretch out to the crack of doom?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Another yet! A seventh! I'll see no more:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And yet the eighth appears, who bears a glass

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Which shows me many more; and some I see

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That two-fold balls and treble scepters carry:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Horrible sight! Now, I see, 'tis true;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: For the blood-bolter'd Banquo smiles upon me,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And points at them for his.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Apparitions vanish

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: What, is this so?

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Ay, sir, all this is so: but why

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Stands Macbeth thus amazedly?

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Come, sisters, cheer we up his sprites,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: And show the best of our delights:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: I'll charm the air to give a sound,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: While you perform your antic round:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: That this great king may kindly say,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Our duties did his welcome pay.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Music. The witches dance and then vanish, with HECATE

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Where are they? Gone? Let this pernicious hour

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stand aye accursed in the calendar!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come in, without there!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Enter LENNOX

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: What's your grace's will?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Saw you the weird sisters?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: No, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Came they not by you?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: No, indeed, my lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Infected be the air whereon they ride;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And damn'd all those that trust them! I did hear

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The galloping of horse: who was't came by?

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: 'Tis two or three, my lord, that bring you word

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Macduff is fled to England.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Fled to England!

speaker: LENNOX
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Time, thou anticipatest my dread exploits:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The flighty purpose never is o'ertook

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Unless the deed go with it; from this moment

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The very firstlings of my heart shall be

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The firstlings of my hand. And even now,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To crown my thoughts with acts, be it thought and done:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The castle of Macduff I will surprise;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Seize upon Fife; give to the edge o' the sword

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: His wife, his babes, and all unfortunate souls

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: That trace him in his line. No boasting like a fool;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: This deed I'll do before this purpose cool.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But no more sights!--Where are these gentlemen?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Come, bring me where they are.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
